newsitem.title: CHINA: Beijing to keep control of China Telecom - paper.
newsitem.headline: Beijing to keep control of China Telecom - paper.

text.p: Listing of China Telecom (HK) Ltd in Hong Kong will not give foreign investors a controlling say in the domestic market and Beijing will retain control of the firm, the South China Morning Post reported on Monday.
"A foreigner buying some shares has no relation to the issue of operating in China," the newspaper quoted Posts and Telecommunications Minister Wu Jichuan as saying.
"A shareholder who purchases 10 million yuan worth of shares will not come to China saying that he wants to participate in management of operations," Wu was quoted as saying.
The paper said the listing would be the first opportunity for foreign investors to buy shares in mainland telecommunications firms.
The listing of China Telecom (HK) is a capital-raising exercise and will be a step forward in the reform of the mainland's telecommunications market, Wu said.
Currently, foreign investors are not allowed to operate or to have direct stakes in mainland telecommunications companies.
In June, China Telecom (HK)'s parent China Telecom had said the company was studying a listing for the Hong Kong subsidiary and a listing was expected in the near future.
Market sources had said the issue was expected to come on to the market by the end of 1997.

China Telecom, the operating arm of the Ministry of Posts and Telecommunications, had earlier agreed to buy a 5.5 percent stake in HongKong Telecommunications Ltd from the Hong Kong firm's parent Cable & Wireless Plc.
